original_title: Four office trains cancelled on Tuesday (25)
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka Railways said nearly four train journeys were cancelled on Tuesday (25) morning due to the strike action launched by railway power-set workers.
Operations Superintendent of Sri Lanka Railways M. J. Indipolage said the cancelled train journeys were office trains.
He said around 60 train journeys were canceled on Monday (24).
The trade union action launched by railway power-set workers citing multiple demands, including the slashing of overtime payments, and delayed promotions, was suspended on Monday (24).
Court prevents protest in Fort; Trade Unions continue protest despite rainfall
Newsline | Non Essential Imports must be curbed | Prof. Lalithasiri Gunaruwan | 24th July 2023
